website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy ricer that is both comfortable and easy to use, although some found it to be a little too large in terms of usage and storage.
pros: All-metal construction from commercial-grade stainless steel
Handles are comfortable and easy to use
Fits over bowls and pots well for less mess
cons: The pin that holds it all together comes out too easily if you tilt it

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Thanksgiving Mashed Potatoes !
customer_reviews.text: I'm a new fan! Glad I picked this one because I had a whole lot of mashed potatoes to make. My only complain is that the pin comes out too easily. If you tilt it a little it comes apart. It's suppose to come apart for cleaning but if it had a lock to hold it in place, it would be an improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: I have tried various ricers and Norpro is the best. The handle is comfortable and it holds enough ...
customer_reviews.text: I have tried various ricers and Norpro is the best. The handle is comfortable and it holds enough potatoes to make quick work of ricing. Some people say that the pin at the front of the ricer doesn't hold the ricer together. If you turn the pin so that the hook of the pin faces forward the pin locks in place. There weren't any instructions with the ricer so you just had to observe this from what the ricer looked like on the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene Litynski

customer_reviews.title: Study, and a large size cup.
customer_reviews.text: I like it and it seems to be sturdy. I wouldn't put it in the dishwasher, though. I would have preferred the handles to have silicone for a better grip, but it did make smooth mashed potatoes. The cup is larger than other ricers I've seen, which is why I bought it. You have to be sure the potatoes are cooked til tender. Wash it immediately after getting all the potatoes through (even before completing your dish), and you won't have a problem getting it clean....all those tiny holes will clog easily.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, can’t understand why I didn’t have one earlier. I suspect there will be a load of these bought for Christmas presents. The hindge pin is odd as it runs in a slotted hole and only engages at the loop ends. The problem is easily improved by slightly flattening the pin end. (See photo.)
customer_reviews.author: R. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great Ricer - Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Makes light and smooth mashed potatoes. First time I've had a ricer and it works great. I can't believe I waited this long to purchase one. I like the Norpro in particular. It's very sturdy. Easy to take it apart and it's stainless steel so I can pop it in the dishwasher to get it sparkling clean. Good handgrips, very comfortable. Screens on both sides makes quick work of the ricing. Great addition to my kitchen tools.
customer_reviews.author: Raggedy

customer_reviews.title: Fluffiest potatoes I've ever made!
customer_reviews.text: Upset I didn't buy one of these sooner! I have been making the most fantastically fluffy and smooth mashed potatoes since I purchased this ricer. I'm thrilled with its performance. It's a bit of a pain to clean, requiring quite a bit of scrubbing and, at times, soaking, but it's worth the work!
customer_reviews.author: KM Channel

customer_reviews.title: Also cleaning this is not easy because it has a lot of gaps around the ...
customer_reviews.text: Questionable quality and craftsmanship. Definitely Not suited for comercial use where food safety is absolutely vital (or even home use for that matter). It had a lot of lose pointy metal sticking outwards on the holes and around the unit. I found pieces getting on the potatoes. Also cleaning this is not easy because it has a lot of gaps around the seams of the unit where food will easily get trapped/clogged. Which later becomes moldy. This cannot be thoroughly cleaned by simply hand washing. Bad construction.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: A Fine Ricer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend because he wanted it to make mashed potatoes. He is strong like ox, and it stands up to his meaty grip. When asked for comment, he said, "I can only imagine what else I could rice with this."
customer_reviews.author: Civel

customer_reviews.title: Now this is a ricer!  STRONG!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make hash browns. You load the shredded potatoes and squeeze the water out of them before frying. After breaking a couple of others these have proven to be impossible to break. Maybe the Hulk could bend them, but I can't hurt them.
customer_reviews.author: M. Morales

customer_reviews.title: I've had it for the past 22 years and still works great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter, who wanted one. I have the exact same brand, I've had it for the past 22 years and still works great!
customer_reviews.author: CaroleR

customer_reviews.title: What the heck is a ricer????
customer_reviews.text: Last year at Thanksgiving, I was a guest at my mother-inlaw's house. She was boiling potatos for dinner when suddenly she pulled out a "ricer." In my 52 years, I have NEVER heard of a ricer and watched her use it. I have to admit, they were the best mashed potatos that I have ever had. My 23 year old son is a great cook and he uses the ricer more than I do. Are you tired of lumpy mashed potatos? If so, a ricer is the solution. Once you use it, you will be hooked for life.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Dorst

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE RICERS
customer_reviews.text: MAKE THE BEST MASH POTATOES OF YOUR LIFE WITH EASE! I upgraded to this one from a different ricer with less ricing capacity, and am so glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: It works great. A lot better than using cheese cloth and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this potato ricer for squeezing herbs for tinctures. It works great. A lot better than using cheese cloth and wasting liquid.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Yach

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the other negative reviews I wasn't sure about this ricer. I'm glad I got it though! It works really well, we use it with red potatoes so they're not too big. The nice thing about this ricer compared to the traditional round design is that it has lots of surface to rice the potatoes. It was quick and we made short work of 5 pounds of potatoes. The only thing I don't like about it is that if you're not careful the pin holding the parts together might slip out, this happened once for me. Overall it's really easy to assemble/disassemble and clean.
customer_reviews.author: kathym

customer_reviews.title: Mashed potatoes fit for a king
customer_reviews.text: Solid product, difficult to clean sometimes, but you will make some QUALITY mashed potatoes with this baby, look up the video Gordon Ramsay does with one of these to make king worthy taters.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Most Important Part Is The Weakest Part!
customer_reviews.text: The part that pushes the potato through is made of very cheap and thin metal. The flat surface needs to be three times thicker, only the second use it bent! Everything else on this is very thick and strong. Baffled as to why this was overlooked. I would have given it a 5 star otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Kris P.

customer_reviews.title: Great for straining spinach
customer_reviews.text: We use this to drain thawed spinach for varios recipes. This process used to be time consuming and frustrating since it had to be done by hand. This strainer really speeds up the process.
customer_reviews.author: nola504

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for ringing out zoodles and cauliflower rice as well.
customer_reviews.author: elayne derby

customer_reviews.title: Makes wonderful mashed potatoes!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great help at Thanksgiving! It's really large and was wonderful to make a large quantity of mashed potatoes very quickly. The mashed potatoes were light and fluffy and so much better than when you make them using an electric mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Everett

customer_reviews.title: Not professional grade as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: After my first use the metal bent. The item Didn’t align correctly. Threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Veil

customer_reviews.title: Stainless
customer_reviews.text: Works great easy to use and easy to clean, What more could you ask for ?!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Etter

customer_reviews.title: A nicer ricer
customer_reviews.text: This ricer works good for the price. I like lumpless fluffy mashed potatos & this unit really helps to make that happen, but I only gave it a 4 star rating because it doesn't process all the product placed in it in one ricing. Some of the product squeezes between the bucket & the press & doesn't make it through the ricer which requires it being re-fed, but that's not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Bubble Baggins

customer_reviews.title: Heavy clunky
customer_reviews.text: Heavy and clunky, much better ricers out there, which I sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Elenakimou

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Useful to help make smooth delicious mashed potatoes and other mashed vegetable.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, fast, easy. The most popular dish at our holiday meal!
customer_reviews.text: Had no idea what to expect. Peeled, cubed and boiled 10 lbs potatoes with two bay leaves, placed them in this tool in batches, squeezed out the excess water and pressed potatoes through. Added melted warm butter, warmed cream, salt and pepper and gently folded together. Fun and easier than beating them with a masher. The less you work them, the less "gluey" they become from the starch. Hit of Thanksgiving, the first dish emptied, and the was a minor skirmish over the last few servings. Mashed potatoes usually play a spring role, but these, made in this tool, we're special!
customer_reviews.author: Sammie Jo

customer_reviews.title: A for ME moment.
customer_reviews.text: This was a selfie...I wanted to replace an old consumer unit. I have used it twice and love the way it works and cleans.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: A beautifully easy and simple ricer!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how I lived without this thing in my life. I used to spend lots of time squishing and squishing the same potato just to have chunks left over, and sore arms. This baby smashes those spuds in seconds with hardly any effort. It's a really quick clean up, too.
customer_reviews.author: daocmom

customer_reviews.title: Potato Ricer
customer_reviews.text: Great Ricer. Very easy to use and plenty of room for a large amount of potatoes. A time saver. You can get through a large amount of potatoes in a short time. I also like that you pull a pin to take it apart to wash in dishwasher and it is stainless so no rust. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mary B

customer_reviews.title: Makes the smoothest mashed potatoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite product to use for making perfect mashed potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light and Fluffy
customer_reviews.text: This item allowed me to make the best mashed potatoes of my life!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Norma Spillios

customer_reviews.title: Best ricer ever
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended from an online recipe for ricing potatoes. The best ricer I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: James S Rochford

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Looked good, felt substantial, but it bent irretrievably on first use.
customer_reviews.author: D S

customer_reviews.title: Not used as ricer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to press herbal tinctures, infusions, decoctions, etc. The handle on top has developed a slight bend but this is normal given the amount of pressure.
customer_reviews.author: L Newman

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Was Hoping For
customer_reviews.text: Having used one of these from Williams Sonoma, I wasn't expecting this one to feel so cheap. I do expect this to break or cut me.
customer_reviews.author: Don Winkleblech

customer_reviews.title: Best ricer ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! We have a small one that is hard to use and hurts your hand....this one makes the work so fast and easy!!! We riced 10 lbs of potatoes in no time!! Lefse has never been easier to make!
customer_reviews.author: Christie Lowe

customer_reviews.title: it works great
customer_reviews.text: this is an awesome tool that I'm using with cauliflower
customer_reviews.author: D. Alley

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I only gave this 3 stars because I don't use it much because it is too big for my hands and I don't have enough strength to press it. I wish I had bought the smaller version. Good quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This device is a life saver!!!! Very sturdy and durable and super easy to clean!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Silva

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: Was nice for a little bit but it broke after a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Partida

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful thing since it means more lefsa
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Birthday gift for my Mom because she was having trouble using her old one. She says this design makes it so much easier. This is a wonderful thing since it means more lefsa!
customer_reviews.author: ScatterBun

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Mashed 12 large potatoes like a pro for Thanksgiving. Worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Tidwell

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Not sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I used this once as the handles bent half way through one pot of mashed potatoes. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Adamologist

customer_reviews.title: Works great easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: There was a metal splinter on the handle that got me. It was like a wire fused to the handle. Pair of pliers pulled it off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Fujikawa

customer_reviews.title: High quality product, easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, mom used one of these a long time ago, so glad to find it here. Easy to use despite my arthritic hands, and easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Bettyp

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Finally. A ricer that REALLY IS durable and does a fantastic job
customer_reviews.author: Joshua A.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful ricer
customer_reviews.text: The ricer is great, it is sturdy and of good quality, it is of better quality than one I had several years ago and I am sure it will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia B. Lipton

customer_reviews.title: Not a well built unit.
customer_reviews.text: Broke during first use. The weld failed that kept the pin in place.
customer_reviews.author: Zig

customer_reviews.title: Great little kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: Have always wanted one... works as great as I imagined! Used it for squeezing the liquid out of canned spinach and was amazed. Can't wait to try it with mashed potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Eggnog Head

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: It still works but it broke the first time I used it. Best way to do mashed potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amaizing Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Potato Ricer I ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best potato ricer that I have ever owned! If you don't like lumps in your mashed potatoes then run them through this thing. Also good tool for making potato dough for gnochi
customer_reviews.author: Chris G.

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: A potato rises that is easy to use along with durability. My mashed potatoes are much more creamier. Great kitchen gadget!
customer_reviews.author: Pita

customer_reviews.title: This ricer did a nice job with the potatoes
customer_reviews.text: This ricer did a nice job with the potatoes. Unfortunately, I had left the skins on, and the skins stuck in the ricer and prevented it from working as smooth as it could have. I am looking forward to using peeled potatoes on the next try. This is heavy duty and should hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Sandefur

customer_reviews.title: Great product! A must have.
customer_reviews.text: Remarkably durable, easy to use and clean, and makes amazing mashed potatoes or riced cauliflower.
customer_reviews.author: DAN HICKEY

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's what chefs use to make small batches ofmashed potatoes. Clean and smooth!
customer_reviews.author: John Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Made over 15 lbs of mashed potatoes with ease. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: DVT

customer_reviews.title: We love this potato ricer and use it a few times ...
customer_reviews.text: We love this potato ricer and use it a few times a week. I made pomagranate juice with it the other day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: poorly designed - It bent initially in the handle and ...
customer_reviews.text: poorly designed - It bent initially in the handle and we were able to fix it enough to use. It quickly bent again - unusable after that.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Would give five stars if the sides were perforated too. just my opinion. Very sturdy - should last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Smith

customer_reviews.title: A little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I used this to squeeze spinach very dry, rather than for potatoes. It worked well, but it's clearly not commercial quality despite the name; it came close to breaking every time I gave it a really good squeeze. The spinach also had a tendency to leak out through some small gaps in the construction, and I assume potatoes would do the same. So I'll keep it and use it, but I'm already looking for a better-quality option.
customer_reviews.author: DogMaTX

customer_reviews.title: I love this ricer!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I had an old one from the 1950's. The commercial Ricer is out standing!!! It is easy to use and easy to clean!!!
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: ... using a ricer not this one couldn't believe how easy this one was to use the boiled potatoes went ...
customer_reviews.text: I usually have a very hard time using a ricer not this one couldn't believe how easy this one was to use the boiled potatoes went through this ricer like a breeze ...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: built for a life time
customer_reviews.text: This baby is the goods! I use it for making lefse makes short work of the potatoes.Its very well built supper strong,easy to clean I love it.
customer_reviews.author: david harvey

customer_reviews.title: Potatobricer
customer_reviews.text: This is well made and exactly what I was looking for. I recommend this product. Makes the best creamy potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: cz

customer_reviews.title: Broke after three uses
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Norpro Ricer and used it to rice about 10 lbs of potatoes on Thanksgiving. It seemed to work OK but the handle was bending a little when I applied a lot of pressure. It finished the job though and I thought it would be OK. The last time I used it, only the third time, the metal hinge that holds the handle on bent and I was unable to get it to work. I tried my damnedest to get it back into place with no luck. I would not purchase this item. A ricer should be able to take some strain without bending. Be warned.
customer_reviews.author: D313

customer_reviews.title: good item
customer_reviews.text: For my daughter-in-law from Peru, the country of potatoes, they have many dishes. Just like her mother's. good steel item.
customer_reviews.author: rainey

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen tool.
customer_reviews.text: Use to strain foods such as spinach. Makes making mashed potatoes a breeze. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: student

customer_reviews.title: I love this ricer!
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing bad to say about this machine! It makes the BEST mashed potatoes ever! It is so easy to use. The only bad thing is the clean up but the benefits outway this.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: the last was a big disappointment and hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: this is the 2nd potato ricer I have bought.. the last was a big disappointment and hard to clean.. this one I would highly recommend as it is great for the job and easily cleaned
customer_reviews.author: Colin Taylor

customer_reviews.title: potato ricer
customer_reviews.text: potato ricer easy to use, no hard pushing, easy break down, easy cleaning great product. my wife really likes to squeeze the potatoes .
customer_reviews.author: red from the shaver head

customer_reviews.title: Awesome piece! I've been making lefse for about 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome piece! I've been making lefse for about 3 years and this is by far the highest quality to handle all of the potatoes that I rice.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Voight

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality and value for money, very pleased indeed!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hall

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Made excellent, lump free potatoes! Very easy to use- need some strength to press potatoes. Remove pin to clean press.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie A Richardson Shank

customer_reviews.title: Super ricer
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a more conventional ricer with this one. Greater capacity means fewer fills and it takes much less effort. When ricing potatoes, they are almost creamy to start.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: folded up on the first using...
customer_reviews.text: Commercial? Where, in slobovia? this thing actually FOLDED UP when I attempted to rice a pair of par boiled sweet potato....It went pretty much from the box, into the garbage can. WHAT A PIECE OF CRAP!
customer_reviews.author: adam kurtzman

customer_reviews.title: NOT for squeezing the starch out of potatoes.
customer_reviews.text: This works OK for a potato ricer with cooked potatoes for mashed potatoes. However, I also use it for squeezing the starch out of grated potatoes before frying them, and it bent the first time. Useless for that.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to handle Handles uncomfortrable.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to use. Volume of basket too large. Span of handles too wide for use. Difficult to remove all products
customer_reviews.author: Donald Mitok

customer_reviews.title: Small potatoes
customer_reviews.text: Product would fine strong construction and stainless steel.Functions what it should.The Big issue is the fact that they have FINGERLING POTATOES pictured on the box.I an a Exec Chef and it is fine for a couples dinner but sad for large production.Picture is misleading and false advertising..
customer_reviews.author: Trackerdroid

customer_reviews.title: The Better Built Replacement
customer_reviews.text: My son, who's otherwise a great cook, sometimes seems not to know his own strength which resulted in our last ricer looking like one of David Moore's abstract sculptures filled with unexpected curve. Though this ricer looks a bit like the others, while costing somewhat more, it's well worth the money. Suffice it to say it's built better and more heavily, making it much more likely to be handed on to my son someday. If you've not had mashed potatoes made with a ricer, you've not had real mashed potatoes. They're simply better in both texture and taste. The ricer works well with squash, rutabaga, parsnips and even carrots, even well cooked beans - any well cooked, non-stringy vegetable.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitchen Tool
customer_reviews.text: Manufactured out of stainless steel, This ricer is dish washer safe and almost indestructable. My first one worked for 25 years until I let my 3 year old granddaughter play with it. Make's perfectly riced potatoes for mashed, Polish pierogis or Italian gnocchi. Pay the extra money and get this kitchen tool. Cheap plastic imitations are worthless.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but Inefficient
customer_reviews.text: This is described as a commercial grade, and it's fairly thick stainless steel construction justifies that. The problem I have with operating it, is that potato in the hopper squishes through gaps around the "pusher" and escapes the tool rather than being pushed through the strainer holes. If it was built with closer tolerances, this would be less of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: traveler22

customer_reviews.title: None makes better mashed taters than this bad boy
customer_reviews.text: This is the one ricer that ruled them all. None makes better mashed taters than this bad boy! And it doesn't stop there either. you can rice many different veggies with this tool. Don't think just buy it, I love mine and its so easy to clean.,.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming, and it took three shiipings
customer_reviews.text: Works best with baked potatoes and degrades from there. Softer products ooze out around the edges of the pusher, up to half end up in the back. The original purchase was returned for misaligned assembly. The pusher handle was cocked off to the right by fifteen degrees. The replacement was returned after the spot welds connecting the pusher face to the handle failed while ricing baked potatoes for a large Duchess serving at a dinner. Ten pounds shouldn't a life cycle limit, even if it was during a single prep period. The final replacement hasn't failed, yet. There is the possibility of another large Duchess prep. However, at this point it might be more reliable to use the food mill.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Nice ricer. This one holds quite a bit so ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice ricer. This one holds quite a bit so it makes the job go quickly. The construction seems sturdy and it breaks apart easily for washing. I saw a few reviews when trying to decide to buy that the handles bent when using. My question is what were you shoving in there. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that the pin holding the two pieces together seems to want to pop out of one end easily. Can be slightly annoying if you have multiple things to rice like a large batch of potato's for making gnocchi like I do. Otherwise good product.
customer_reviews.author: Chocolate Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: After first use I gave this ricer a 5 star rating. Made great fluffy potatoes. Some waste because masher did not go completely to screen, but I could live with that, Fine on second use. Third time the hinge pin bent, the unit came apart into pieces and couldn't be reassembled for use. I give it one star because I can't give it none.
customer_reviews.author: Buz from Jersey

customer_reviews.title: Trust me, you won’t be disappointed.  Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This ricer is fabulous. We make our own gnocchi. Ricing the potatoes is an important step in preparing it. We have two ricers. One is from an upscale, well known store. This ricer is less expensive AND it works like a champion! The BEST design element of it is cleaning it. My expensive one takes me twice as long to clean. This one comes apart. It’s a snap to clean. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence A Lalli

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made☹️
customer_reviews.text: As the picture shows, this is a poorly made product and bent badly on only the 5th use. Also, Like another reviewer said, the piece that presses the food agains the screen doesn’t meet so not everything gets pressed through the screen.
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: It may be the way they all work, but
customer_reviews.text: It may be the way they all work, but I lost a lot of potato oozing up the sides over the top. I used it for sweet potatoes, which I know are fibrous. I did like the fact that the fibers were left behind. It makes using sweet potatoes in recipes much nicer without the stringy fibers.
customer_reviews.author: flsmw

customer_reviews.title: YUGE - like a viking mallet, smooth potatoes
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, dependable, and large! Love this device. It is large in length and large in it's capacity for big chunks of potatoes. This hefty instrument produces deliciously creamy and airy mashed potatoes. Shortened mashing time in half.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: P
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars all the way! Makes the best mashed potatoes....I've always done them in my mixer and now I know why they were always starchy. Not starchy at all when made this way!
customer_reviews.author: Diane M

customer_reviews.title: The BEST mashed pitatoes
customer_reviews.text: Making garlic mashed potatoes for years, but using the ricer not a lump in the pot. If you want smooth; melt in your mouth potatoes, then you need this ricer, better than restaurant quality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This one will never break or bend out of shape!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Kingsley

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I've never had one of these before, but it works well. If I'm in a rush, I will skip peeling the potatoes and just mash them with the skins on. Makes great mashed potatoes! Going to try cauliflower next...
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Two

customer_reviews.title: Best Out There
customer_reviews.text: For years I'd been looking for a good ricer to make mashed potatoes. This one turned out to be exceptional in every respect: Solid workmanship; easy to clean; and not overly large.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is built tough! I was so pleased with the craftsmanship in this ricer, it is built of a good stout quality of stainless steel and in no way flimsy. This will last my lifetime for sure and be useful for the generations after me. It was a first for us using this to make mashed potatoes after a lifetime of the wire-form masher and I am in awe of the difference. Everyone in my family loves the new way of making mashed potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: SantaTim

customer_reviews.title: BAD DESIGN—no consumer testing
customer_reviews.text: Pros Heavy construction Easy to take apart Cons Pseudo sharp edges on handle VERY SMALL mesh Mashes food---Does not rice food The stop is too high to fully press the top part against the mesh. Expensive bad design. Avoid this product
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: Does the work and it's so easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool. Great design that makes it easier to rice the potatoes but also makes it so easy to clean. You are able to wash each part separately. A little pricer than average potato ricer but a game changer
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd Gotten One of These Sooner!
customer_reviews.text: For years I've been peeling potatoes by hand whenever I made mashed potatoes. Not something I enjoyed. A friend recommended I get a ricer. I saw this Norpro Stainless Steel Commercial one on Amazon. It was a good price and free shipping - I decided to take a chance. I was surprised at how substantial and sturdy it felt. So many things you buy these days are so flimsy. I've used it a few times already and it works great and cleanup is a snap!
customer_reviews.author: TundraPup

customer_reviews.title: GREAT kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this tool! It is the easiest way to rice hot, cooked potatoes for great mashed potatoes. Very easy to use (one handed, rices from two sides) and clean. MUCH more practical, useful and cheaper than a food mill, in my opinion. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Donoho

customer_reviews.title: Liked, will purchase again if needed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use for family gatherings to try "ricing" mashed potatoes. Holds a surprisingly large amount f potatoes in the base of the press, is easy to squeeze and washed well in the dishwasher. Easy to use, made nicely sized potato "rice". Would purchase again, well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Stone Age device
customer_reviews.text: Really bad quality and hard to use. Get the one from Williams Sonoma
customer_reviews.author: ZPrime

product_meta.title: Norpro Stainless Steel Commercial Potato Ricer, 11.5in/29cm, As Shown
product_meta.description:
Measures: 11.5” x 4.5" x 4" / 29cm x 11.5cm x 10cm
Capacity: 2.75 cups / 22 ounces
Potato ricers incorporate air into your boiled potatoes, making them light, fluffy and lump free. Made of high quality, commercial grade stainless steel. Fits over pots and bowls for a no-mess use. Also great for mashing cooked apples and vegetables such as carrots, cauliflower, yams, tomatoes and more. Great for making homemade baby food. Easy to use and clean. Hand washing recommended.

 Norpro was founded in 1973 with a vision to design, manufacture, and supply the highest caliber kitchenware. Norpro’s offering of innovative, high quality product for cooking, preparing and serving food are produced with superior materials and craftsmanship.

Fits over pots and bowls for a no-mess use.
